intro: Gutierrezia lucida, commonly known as brittleblow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, yellow composite flowers and hairy, branched stems. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It produces small, elongated seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize disturbed areas. Gutierrezia lucida is also valued for its role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
